full_summary:
===============

**Tender Announcement: Fishway Replacement - Lomond River, NL**

**Reference Number:** PW-_PWD-009-7869
**Solicitation Number:** EA011-231043/A

**Introduction**
---------------

Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) invites qualified contractors to submit a proposal for the Fishway Replacement project at Lomond River, Newfoundland and Labrador. This project involves the replacement of an existing fishway with a new structure that meets the required standards and specifications.

**Project Requirements**
------------------------

The winner of this project will be responsible for the design, construction, and maintenance of the entire fishway replacement project, including:

* Design and construction of a temporary access road and laydown on the west side of the river
* Design and construction of a temporary access road on the east side of the river for bridge launch and installation
* Development of a fish relocation program to be implemented between June 1st to September 30th
* Construction of a new reinforced concrete vertical slot fishway structure
* Installation of new reinforced concrete diversion walls and rock anchors
* Construction of a new attraction flow piping system
* Installation of rip-rap and armor stone along the riverbank

**Important Notice**
--------------------

This procurement will involve a two-phase process, where bidders will first need to qualify and then submit a financial bid if they are shortlisted. Bidders are required to submit their proposals through the e-tendering portal (BuyandSell.gc.ca) and shall only base their bids on documents downloaded from this portal.

**Contact Information**
----------------------

For any inquiries, please contact:
Alexandria Dwyer
Public Works and Government Services Canada
(709) 330-6330 or [Alexandria.Dwyer@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca](mailto:Alexandria.Dwyer@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca)

**Trade Agreement:**
---------------------

Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Estimated Value**
-------------------

$1,000,001 to $5,000,000

**Delivery Date**
----------------

60 weeks after the contract award.

**Bid Security**
----------------

A bid security will be required for this project, contingent on the award of a contract in Phase Two. 

Legal Note
-----------

Government Canada retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. Unless inconsistent with the context, masculine nouns refer to both masculine and feminine persons,
